clinical_study.brief_title: Knowledge and Perceptions Regarding JSSK and RBSK in Patients and Nurses: A Comparative Study
clinical_study.official_title: Knowledge and Perceptions Regarding Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (JSSK) and Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK) Programs in the Patients/Patient Attendants,Nursing Students and in Service Nurses: A Comparative Study

brief_summary.textblock: Observational, cross sectional study, carried out with the help of a pre-designed and pre-tested questionnaire with the research hypothesis as: Knowledge and perception regarding JSSK and RBSK in nursing students is better as compared to in-service nurses as well as patients/patient attendants (attending LHMC and associated hospitals, New Delhi, India)

detailed_description.textblock:
The objectives of the study were to:
1. To study knowledge and perceptions regarding JSSK and RBSK programs in the patients/patient attendants, nursing students and in-service nurses attending LHMC and associated hospitals.
2. To compare knowledge and perceptions regarding JSSK and RBSK programs in the patients/patient attendants, nursing students and in-service nurses attending LHMC and associated hospitals.
3. To identify factors contributing to knowledge regarding JSSK and RBSK programs in the patients/patient attendants, nursing students and in-service nurses attending LHMC and associated hospitals.

primary_outcome.measure: Knowledge and perception regarding JSSK and RBSK in study population groups
primary_outcome.description: The knowledge and perception will be evaluated by yes, no responses using predesigned and pretested questionnaire presented to each of the three study groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the knowledge and perception regarding JSSK and RBSK in study population groups
secondary_outcome.description: The knowledge and perception will be compared using yes and no responses obtained on predesigned and pretested questionnaire presented to each of the three study groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Study of factors contributing to knowledge regarding JSSK and RBSK in study population groups
secondary_outcome.description: The factors will be identified and evaluated using yes and no responses obtained on the predesigned and pretested questionnaire presented to each of the three study groups.

arm_group.description: Study subjects will be females. Age at enrolment should be more than 18 years. Attending Department of Paediatrics OPD/emergency/well-baby clinics/immunisation clinics OR Department of Gynaecology and Obstetrics OPD/emergency/Ante-natal clinics/Post-natal clinics of Lady Hardinge Medical College and associated hospitals. Written informed consent to participate in the study.
Pursuing Bsc Nursing(in their final year) or intern of college of nursing LHMC Written informed consent to participate in the study

Posted in Department of Paediatrics indoor/OPD/well-baby clinics/immunisation clinics or Department of Gynaecology and Obstetrics indoor/OPD/emergency/Ante-natal clinics/Post-natal clinics of Lady Hardinge Medical College and associated hospitals. Written informed consent to participate in the study.

study_pop.textblock: 100 participants enrolled from the patients/attendant subset,93 Nursing students(final year) and interns from the Nursing college, LHMC along with 100 nurses posted in the LHMC and associated hospitals enrolled in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Group 1) Patients/Attendants:
- All study subjects must be female.
- Age more than 18 years.
- Written informed consent to participate in the study.
Group 2) Nursing Student:
- Students / intern at College of nursing LHMC pursuing Bsc Nursing
- Written informed consent to participate in the study
Group 3) In-service Nurses:
- Posted in Department of Paediatrics indoor/OPD/well-baby clinics/immunisation clinics or Department of Gynaecology and Obstetrics indoor/OPD/emergency/Ante-natal clinics/Post-natal clinics of Lady Hardinge Medical College and associated hospitals.
- Written informed consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Males for the patient/attendant group 1
